website_summaries.verdict: A brand synonymous with providing alternative heat and light for over a century, these non-messy candles are perfect for any emergency situation.
pros: Each candle burns for 100 hours without the wax drips and smoke found in traditional candles
The top snaps off to act as a windscreen against the elements and to protect clothing while outdoors
cons: Freezes in temperatures at and below 42 degrees
in situations like an auto breakdown, candle should not sit on dashboard

customer_reviews.title: Every home should have one of these.
customer_reviews.text: Good to have on hand for emergency situations. It's better to have a box of these and not need them, than to be stuck in the dark for days. I have burned one for the better part of a day and don't think I put a dent in it. I wad concerned that there might be a chemical scent, but haven't noticed anything yet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Redhouse

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok
customer_reviews.text: Containers are plastic, the wick protrudes only a tiny bit. You will need to use pliers to pull it out more for more efficient burn. Didn’t test the 100-hr burn. Hope it’s true.
customer_reviews.author: ohhnest

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat, good value, low flame from factory the only gripe.
customer_reviews.text: The wick as supplied is very low / makes for a pretty puny candle. Obviously how they rate it at 100hrs. I'm becoming very annoyed at the "only available as addon" stuff from Amazon, but I guess that's how they are making up for their losses on PRIME? There were indeed 4 in the box, price point was great, pulling up the wick a touch via pliers helped a ton, not timed one but I presume that has taken 40% or so off the '100 hours' of run time. Still a great thing to have in the house here in Hurricane Land or car glove box in areas that get heavy snow.
customer_reviews.author: N3GLV

customer_reviews.title: It's good to have a proven
customer_reviews.text: We live in a semi-rural area where the power occasionally goes out for hours at a time. It's good to have a proven, hassle-free emergency candle like this around. Solid product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shanafelt

customer_reviews.title: Frozen at 16 degrees!
customer_reviews.text: I came home from work today and found my ordered candles on the front porch. I just opened them and the oil is about 85% frozen. It's 16 degrees outside. I suspect, given that some of it is still in liquid form, that it would work, though I can't be completely sure. I really wasn't expecting them to freeze like that above zero. It seems to me that emergency candles need to hold up better in extreme cold (many probably buy them for winter vehicles). I can't speak to how they work, only to comment on the freezing point...that may be a consideration for those looking to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Good to go - kinda
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this product. On one hand, it's a great emergency light source that is supposed to work for 100 hours. On the other hand, it's a fairly large system and multiple units take up a lot of room. It's also filled with fluid and I am paranoid it will leak, evaporate or explode (keep in mind I am talking about long term storage for emergencies). I kept one and gave the others away.

customer_reviews.title: Great "candles" Long Lasting and reusable.
customer_reviews.text: Great backup light. Just remember to remove the plastic wrap. It tells you on the label, but I took a sharpie and wrote it in big letters so you don't forget. More worried about my wife not knowing to remove wrap before lighting. Burned candle for about 3 hours and worked great. Snuffed it out and now it is ready to use again. Got one in my truck and trailer for emergency heat and light (winter survival). The others are in the house for when the power goes out.

customer_reviews.title: You need to get it!
customer_reviews.text: Give me a good reason why in todays world of more and more storms that every house doesn't have some basic back up supplies - Like this candle. Just after purchasing this, I lost power for about 4 hours one night. (Why does it always go out at night?) I don't smoke but I do keep matches nearby so I lit this up and let it keep me company for awhile. Just having a simple source of light (that you can count on) makes those unexpected times much easier to get threw. Get it. It's cheap.

product_meta.title: Sterno Liquid Wax Candles, 100 Hours
product_meta.description: The Sterno 30278 100-Hour Emergency Liquid Wax Candles are perfect for any emergency situation. The candles come in a pack of (4), burning safe and clean with no messy wax drippings. The high quality wicks prevent smoke and unintended second ignitions. The Sterno 30278 100-Hour Emergency Liquid Wax Candles are proudly made in the USA. For over 100 years the Sterno name has been synonymous with quality and performance in home entertaining, camping and emergency preparedness. Today Sterno delivers the most comprehensive line of portable warming, emergency illumination, butane appliances and catering products to the retail market. We share our customers’ commitment to the environment and continually strive to improve our manufacturing and marketing practices to reduce our impact on the earth. Our iron-clad commitment to excellence ensures perfect performance every time.
